title: Gazza cleared of sex attack over ‘sloppy’ kiss on a train
text:
The football legend wept as the verdict was read out (Picture: Terry Blackburn/Backgrid)

Former England star Paul Gascoigne wept as he was cleared of sexual assault after kissing a woman on a train.

The 52-year-old insisted there was no sexual intention behind him planting the ‘sloppy’ kiss on the stranger, who he claimed had been abused by another passenger.

Gascoigne told Teesside Crown Court he kissed the woman on the York to Newcastle service in August 2018 to boost her confidence after hearing someone call her ‘a fat lass’.

Judge Peter Armstrong told the jury he will now accept a majority verdict on the lesser, alternative count of assault by beating that they are still considering.

Jurors are still considering a lesser alternative charge of assault (Picture: PA)

As he left court, Gascoigne wiped his eye with a tissue and hugged his agent.

When Judge Peter Armstrong summed up the case on Wednesday, he told jurors that ‘assault by beating’ is committed if the defendant ‘intentionally applies unlawful force to another who does not consent to it’.
